title: High ping recently
body:
Recently i have been getting high ping (350 to 700ms) after about 15 minutes into a game (sometimes i have had spikes up to 50,000ms). I have seen quite a few other people in game complaining about high ping. I have a 100Mb/s download and 20Mb/s upload Fibre connection (my ISP is Orcon nz).

Here are the details from my tracert


Tracing route to 103.240.227.5 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1     8 ms     3 ms     *     192.168.20.1

replies.body:
Hi - just wondering if this was resolved?  I've had a similar issue with packet loss after the VOCUS.net.au [175.45.107.94] hop.  I have notable increases in ping from 5-6pm onwards.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Tracing route to 103.240.227.25 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1   308 ms     1 ms     2 ms  192.168.1.1 
  2     8 ms     8 ms     7 ms  57.35.69.111.static.snap.net.nz [111.69.35.57] 
  3     8 ms     8 ms     8 ms  as23655.akl-ix.nz [43.243.21.30] 
  4    33 ms    31 ms    32 ms  as4826.akl-ix.nz [43.243.21.27] 
  5    32 ms    32 ms    33 ms  ten-0-7-0-1.cor01.alb01.akl.VOCUS.net.nz [114.31.202.34]

it seems that it may have just been high load on the servers, because it is all working now

Hiya! Can you try the solutions in the [**Troubleshooting Connection Issues**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) Riot Games Support article and let me know if anything works? Thanks!

> [{quoted}](name=Wuks,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=6eX8KmEO,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-12-27T10:52:54.127+0000)
>
> Hiya! Can you try the solutions in the [**Troubleshooting Connection Issues**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) Riot Games Support article and let me know if anything works? Thanks!

Hi, I tried all of the soloutions and nothing worked, here is a link to the [Netalyzer report](http://n2.netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/summary/id=36ea240d-19533-9d6aaef9-9b2f-457d-9a6e), i will have to wait until tonight to see if the problem happens again, because it is only from 8pm NZT. I will try going wired at that time to see if it is a wireless issue

> [{quoted}](name=lastpotato99,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=6eX8KmEO,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-12-28T03:14:05.856+0000)
>
> Hi, I tried all of the soloutions and nothing worked, here is a link to the [Netalyzer report](http://n2.netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/summary/id=36ea240d-19533-9d6aaef9-9b2f-457d-9a6e), i will have to wait until tonight to see if the problem happens again, because it is only from 8pm NZT. I will try going wired at that time to see if it is a wireless issue

Can you try [**resetting your Internet Explorer settings**](http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/internet-explorer/reset-ie-settings)?

You also have a good amount of packet buffering. You might want to contact your ISP and see if they can reduce that buffering.
